channel.title: Dracula Theme - Blog
channel.description: The journey of building the most universal dark theme ever made.

item.title: 11 New Themes And Updates For Dracula PRO
item.description: Life has been crazy over here, but Dracula continues to evolve and grow.

item.title: 13 new themes, email updates, and PRO news
item.description: It's been a while since I don't send these Dracula updates, right? The main reason is that I've been building a new email platform - Resend].

item.title: 200 Themes!
item.description: When I started this project 8 years ago, I never thought it could become so big. I'm beyond grateful for this fantastic developer community.

item.title: 2020 Halloween Costume Contest
item.description: Halloween is almost here and this year I want to do something different... Introducing the 2020 Halloween Costume Contest!

item.title: 2021 Year in Review
item.description: Transparency is a major value for me, so I thought it would be a good idea to gather some interesting numbers about Dracula in 2021.

item.title: 3 New Themes And Better Code Screenshots
item.description: Last time we saw each other I was telling you all about this new book I wrote. The launch was amazing, it reached

item.title: 32 New Dracula Themes For 2020
item.description: Before I start working like crazy on Dracula PRO, I decided to spend my entire weekend doing some housekeeping on the original Dracula project.

item.title: 3D, Physical Book, And 4 New Themes
item.description: Last year I wrote an e-book called 14 Habits of Highly Productive Developers. I made this specifically for Dracula PRO.

item.title: 6 New Themes And 20 Desktop Icons
item.description: Do you know Swift, PHP, Ruby, Java, Typescript, Go, or C? I'm trying to standardize all the Dracula screenshots using the same code snippet structure.

item.title: $7,128.57 In Sales In 7 Days
item.description: If you have been following me on Twitter, I'm sharing some lessons learned since the Dracula PRO launch. The response from the community has been insane!

item.title: A new theme is coming
item.description: In 2013, I decided to create a theme. At that time there were hundreds of thousands of color schemes out there, but none of them were appealing to me. So I decided to create my own.

item.title: A Quick Spoiler...
item.description: I have some exciting news to share! Dracula PRO will be launched in 3 days on February 11th. It's been quite a ride to get here. I've been studying colors like never before.

item.title: A Vampire Needs Your Help...
item.description: For the past few weeks, I've been working non-stop to make sure that Dracula, the open source project, is well organized and with fewer issues as possible. We even crossed the number of 90 themes, which is totally insane!

item.title: Audiobook, Insomnia, And 7 New Themes
item.description: The last two weeks have been really busy. I decided to create this page to show Dracula PRO's journey.

item.title: AWS, New Wallpapers And Five New Themes
item.description: A couple of days ago, I was configuring some stuff on AWS and noticed that they are using Dracula!

item.title: 14 Best Free Fonts for Programming
item.description: We spend the entire day using code editors, terminal emulators, and other developer tools. Using a font that feels comfortable to your eyes can make a huge difference and improve your productivity.

item.title: Bl3ck Fr1d3y And 5 New Themes
item.description: Dracula PRO and Dracula UI are 40% off. I'm running this Black Friday deal as a way of saying thank you.

item.title: Black Friday And 12 New Dracula Themes
item.description: Dracula PRO is now 40% off! If you are thinking about getting PRO or giving it to a friend, now is the time.

item.title: Black Friday And 7 New Dracula Themes
item.description: If you have considered upgrading your setup, this is the perfect opportunity.

item.title: Celebrating 10 years of Dracula
item.description: This month marks a significant milestone for us â€” the 10th anniversary of Dracula. What started as one theme for one application, has now become a global movement.

item.title: Celebrating 300 Themes With The New Winter Drop
item.description: Today we officially crossed 300 Dracula themes! When I started this project back in 2013 with a single commit.

item.title: Dark Mode Everywhere And 11 New Themes
item.description: I love dark mode and I've been experimenting with different setups lately. One of my favorite tools so far is Night Eye.

item.title: Dracula 100 Themes
item.description: Today is a special day. We have hit 100 themes on Dracula! When I started this little project, I never imagined the community would embrace it the way it did. Thank you so much for everyone involved in this.

item.title: Dracula 2023 Wrapped
item.description: There's a lot to celebrate, but first, I just want to say thank you for making Dracula such a fantastic community to be a part of.

item.title: Dracula AI, 10 New Themes And Emacs For PRO
item.description: We couldn't help ourselves, so we introduced ðŸ¤– Dracula AI (on April 1st)!

item.title: Dracula Community And 6 New Themes
item.description: After dozens of responses, it's clear that Discord is where the cool kids hang out nowadays, so here it is!

item.title: Dracula For CodeSandbox And 9 New Themes
item.description: I don't know about you, but I always struggle to find a good syntax highlighter library for showing code on a page.

item.title: Dracula For Figma, Sketch, And Adobe
item.description: I'm not a designer, but I'm always amazed by the kind of work these people do. Their ability to create entire screens out of a blank canvas is just incredible.

item.title: Dracula Keycaps And 6 New Themes
item.description: After two years of waiting, the GMK Dracula keycaps finally arrived. If you're into mechanical keyboards, you're going to love this.

item.title: Dracula Livestream And 3 New Themes
item.description: The fine folks from Microsoft invited me to talk about how to build your own VS Code theme.

item.title: Dracula-o-ween 2023!
item.description: Is it the spookiest time of the year already? Time truly has wings!

item.title: Dracula On CodePen And Open Startup
item.description: I've always admired this concept of 'open startup' in which people gather all their private metrics and make them public.

item.title: Dracula On GitHub.com And Some Behind-The-Scenes
item.description: I got a LOT of responses about doing Dracula merch, so I started ordering some samples to learn more about how can I make the absolute best products.

item.title: Dracula On Reddit + Discourse And Javadoc Themes
item.description: It's been 7 weeks since the launch of Dracula PRO and I've been sharing some of the lessons learned. I'm not a big Reddit user, but I decided to publish there and it went semi-viral.

item.title: Dracula On Super Nintendo, Tailwind, And LaTeX
item.description: I've been working on some really exciting new projects!

item.title: Dracula On Twitter And 7 New Themes
item.description: I joined Twitter in March 2009 (yes, I'm that old), and it has been my favorite place to stay up to date with the tech community since then.

item.title: Dracula PRO Is Here!
item.description: The wait is over... Dracula PRO is live! This is a very special moment for me. It's been almost 7 years since I launched Dracula, and I'm super excited about this next step.

item.title: Dracula PRO Wallpaper
item.description: Ohhh there is so much exciting news to share that I don't even know where to being. Let's get right to it...

item.title: Dracula Shop Is Here!
item.description: There are 12 custom-designed items over there, such as t-shirts, stickers, hoodies, pins, pullovers, hats, and even baby clothing.

item.title: Dracula Stickers, StackOverflow and 5 new themes
item.description: These past few days have been difficult. I hope you and your family are safe!

item.title: Dracula T-Shirt... A? B? Or C?
item.description: I'm starting to play around with the idea of having Dracula merch! Now I need your help deciding which designs look better.

item.title: Dracula UI Is Now Free And Open Source
item.description: When Dracula UI was first released, it was a paid product hosted on GitHub as a private repository and a private package.

item.title: Dracula UI - Web Or React Native?
item.description: Most templates are built using light colors and later on adapted to dark colors. The process of building a dark theme shouldn't be an afterthought - it should be a top priority. That's why I decided to invest time in this.

item.title: Dracula UI - Week 1
item.description: Our team of 3 (Netto, Zeno, and Cookie) has been hard at work building what we believe will be the best dark-first collection of UI components and patterns.

item.title: Dracula UI - Week 3
item.description: It's been almost two weeks since we last shared an update with you. We have missed you and your feedback.

item.title: Free Wallpapers And New Dracula PRO Price
item.description: On February 11th, Dracula PRO was being launched. Today, exactly six months later, more than 1,143 copies have been sold. What started as a simple side project, became something much bigger.

item.title: Get ready for Dracula Light Mode
item.description: For years, we heard the same question, "Are you going to create a light color scheme?" and the answer always was, "Nope. Dracula can't stand the light".

item.title: GitHub Dark, Big Sur Icons, And 5 New Themes
item.description: Here it is... The moment we've all been waiting for - GitHub finally has a Dark Mode! You can enable it in your settings. I know, it's not a Dracula color palette, but it's better than nothing :P

item.title: How I Made $101,578.04 Selling Colors Online
item.description: Today is a special day. Dracula PRO has hit 100K in sales, which is absolutely insane. When I started this thing I never thought this would happen.

item.title: Interview with Lucas - the new Dracula team member
item.description: Today, I'm excited to introduce you to Lucas. He has joined Dracula to help in our mission to create the best theme for developers in the world.

item.title: It's Halloween!
item.description: I'm getting ready for a big announcement next week, but before we talk about that, I want to share a ton of new themes with you.

item.title: Keycaps V2 And 4 New Themes
item.description: For those of you who are into mechanical keyboards, today is the last day to get the Dracula GMK Keycaps v2.

item.title: Little Vampire And 7 New Themes
item.description: For the next few weeks, I'll be out on paternity leave. This means that I'll be slow to respond to emails, Discord messages, and GitHub issues.

item.title: Make Music With Dracula
item.description: I'm getting ready for a big announcement next week, but before we talk about that, I want to share a ton of new themes with you.

item.title: Making a Physical Book
item.description: I can't believe this is real... My book is now available in hardcover. Building this physical copy has been a really intense process.

item.title: New Dracula Site And Logo
item.description: The Dracula site and logo were the same since 2013. I've always wanted to give it a refresh, but I was never able to prioritize it.

item.title: Podcast About Dracula And Better Windows Support
item.description: It's been a crazy couple of weeks. I have to admit I'm a little bit overwhelmed with all that's happening in the world but, hey, the show must go on.

item.title: Purchasing Parity Power + 4 New Themes
item.description: I'm super happy to announce Purchasing Parity Power on Dracula PRO! Why? Because not everyone earns in dollars.

item.title: Quick Question... Slack Or Discord?
item.description: I've been thinking about creating a Dracula Community for a long time. But I want to make sure we pick the best platform, that's why I need your help.

item.title: Sunsetting Dracula UI
item.description: We decided to sunset Dracula UI to have more time for Dracula Theme, Dracula PRO, and some new projects in 2024.

item.title: The Most Popular Dracula Themes in 2020
item.description: 2021 is here and its first month is almost over. Still, I decided to take a step back and look at all the data from 2020.

item.title: Top Dracula Themes In 2019
item.description: I thought it would be a good idea to gather the most popular Dracula themes from 2019, in case you missed, so here it is.

item.title: Why Is Dracula So Popular?
item.description: Two weeks ago, Dracula showed up on the front page of Hacker News. The thread had 227 comments, but one comment caught my attention.
